lines.text: [Becky is inspecting the android her father has built]
He looks a lot like you. You know, where you were young.
Yeah, well I make him a little handsomer than is was at that age.
Which is what?
Seventeen.
You made him older than me?
Well, you always said you wanted an older brother.
[Jonas is testing the android's motor functions]
Very good, C-17. Now raise your left arm.
[he complies]
All right. Now dangle legs over the table, left side.
[he complies]
Very good. C-17, that's wonderful. Everything's working beautifully.
C-17, is that his name?
Well, it is for now until you help me come up with a better one. Something normal.
Um, how about something like Sting or Prince, you know, like from a rock group?
Which rock group? Igneous or sedimentary?
If anyone tries to reprogram Chip in a negative way, he's programmed to self-destruct.
Destroy himself? How awful.
It's a safety precaution. We could never allow Chip to fall into the wrong hands.
What if they could bypass the system, dad?

Well, I've thought of that, but first they'd have to know that you had a self-destruct system, which is highly unlikely, but if they found it, well... I have a backup system that I could activate by remote.
You could explode me, right dad?
Yes.
[Vogel and JJ have gone to the Carson house to find it abandoned]
He's gone! I knew it! I sensed something was wrong the other night.
Like what?
I don't know, he was acting kind of weird.
He always acts kind of weird.
Weirder than usual. He seemed real anxious to get rid of me and his son was acting certifiable.
You mean his daughter.
Son.
Carson doesn't have a son.
He was away at school.
I'm telling you, I've known Carson for years, he doesn't have a son. He has a daughter, Becky.
Then why would he tell me that kid was his son?
How old did he look?
I don't know. An adolescent. Sixteen? Seventeen?

[starts hyperventilating]
Oh my goodness! He did it! I don't believe it! I don't believe it! He did it, he did it, he did it!
What are you babbling about?
Carson's dream ever since I've known him was to create something. And the thing he wanted to create was...
[Derks' memory lapses]
Yes?
What?
The thing he wanted to create?
Who?

[grabs JJ and shakes him]
Carson! What did he want to create?
What a minute, it's coming... an android! An android that looks and acts like a human. That's who that boy was. He did it. I can't believe he did it.
And I saw it and I talked to it and it fooled me! I thought it was just like any other idiot teenager!

You know what this means? We're gonna be rich! We'll have more money than some small countries. The military will beg my forgiveness and why shouldn't they? I'll sell them a whole army of killer androids. They'll shower me with medals!
I could have my own lab. I could invent again.
You'll have ten new labs!
What about Carson?
What about him?
We don't know where he is.
We'll find him.
Yeah, but he'll never give us the patent, he doesn't like us.
Well, we'll just take the android, go to Washington and get the patent.
But isn't that like stealing?
It's like it, but it isn't. I mean, after all, didn't Carson invent the android while contracting to me?
Yeah, but he probably did it on his own spare time.

[grabs JJ by his jacket]
Do you want your own lab or not?
Let's steal the android.
[the Carsons are on the road to their new home]
I'm hungry, anybody else want to stop for a bite to eat?
I'm starving.
Me, too.
He doesn't have to eat, does he, dad?
I'm programmed to have three meals a day.
That's right.
But why?
Well, wouldn't it seem strange if Chip were having lunch with his friends and he's the only one who doesn't eat?
Kids like to eat. Pizza, hamburger, French fries...
Yeah, but how?
I've equipped him with a micro-compactor that compresses all the food he consumes into tiny little packages he can store for the end of the day.
That is so gross. I'm not hungry anymore.
So, I hear your dad's the new science teacher at school. Is he as cute as you are?
No, he made me cuter.
[after reviewing Chip's recording where he practically told his friends that he's an android]
Dad, he's going to ruin everything if he keeps talking like that!
Why? It was true.
[to Jonas]
You programmed me always to tell the truth.
Yeah, but you don't have to spell it out, micro-brain.
Shouldn't I tell the truth, dad?
No! I mean yes, but human beings have a way of being honest without...
Spilling the beans.
I see. You mean I can be honest without telling the truth.
Right.
Doesn't compute, dad. My logic program rejects it.
Go straight home, plug yourself in and wait 'til I get there. First do my math homework, page 52 in the orange book.
Dad told me never to do your homework or your chores.
Great, now he's turning human on me. Okay, just forget it then. Just go home.
Can I speak to anyone? Eron said she wanted to talk to me after school today.
Eron? No way, forget it! If you see her, run the other way. Understand?
Why?
Because she likes you.
You like Brian, but you're not running away.
Yeah, but that's different, I'm...
Human?
Anyway, who says I like him?
Well, you blushed and your body temperature rose by two degrees. My heat sensors picked it up.
That doesn't mean I like him. Three degrees means I like him, two degrees means he's just okay.
Oh, well his body temperature rose three degrees. Does that mean he likes you?
Hmm, you might be useful someday after all.
[while walking home, Chip encounters Erin and her friend]
Chip, hi!
I'm sorry, Eron, I have to run the other way.
[takes off in the opposite direction]
[Vogel and JJ, wearing cheap disguises, are watching Chip from a distance]
There he is.

[looking through binoculars]
He doesn't look so real. Look at the stiff way he walks.
Not him.
[points at Chip]
Him!
Dinner's ready.
I'm not hungry.
Are you upset because Brian is taking Erin to the dance?
Please just leave me alone.
I can take you to the dance.
That's all I need, a 400-pound robo-geek stepping all over my feet. No thanks. Now would you just go away a quit ruing my life, okay?
I didn't mean to ruin your life, Becky.
Yeah, well you have. Ever since you came into this family.
I'm sorry.
Just forget it. Look, I'm sorry if I hurt your feelings.
That's okay... I deserved it.
[Chip leaves]
Feelings? I don't believe it!
[she rushes to the kitchen were Chip and Jonas are preparing for dinner]
Dad, you're not gonna believe this! Guess what? I hurt Chip's feelings.
Well why would you want to-what?
He said he'd take me to the dance and I said no way and I swear, I hurt his feelings. I could tell.
Now don't jump to any conclusions. You've gotta be rational and scientific. Chip, how do you feel?
Feel?
When Becky said she couldn't go to the dance with you. What was your reaction?
Something heavy, right in my central computer.
Yes?
Something hot, right near my video sensors.
Becky, you may be right. He may be experiencing human emotion.
Wow.
Is that good?
Good? If it's true, it's fantastic!
Becky doesn't like me.
Don't worry.
I won't worry, Dad. I don't know how.
